item.title: Creating Alerts from Logs in Kibana
item.description: I’ve recently deployed the Elastic Stack and set up sending logs to it. To automate certain checks, I then wanted to set up some alerts based on the logs. However, I found that there is several ways that this can be set up in Kibana. Each way has its shortcomings and pre-requisites, which aren’t particularly well documented in Elastic’s documentation. I’ll explain my findings in this post. Types of Kibana Alerts Rules These used to be called Kibana Alerts (for some reason Elastic has done a lot of renaming over the years), and in most cases I found these to be the best choice.
